title: 820-00281 A1707 Battery use -> no backlight...
message:
Hey guys. 
I have an 820-00281 A1707 15'' which teases me a lot. First of all; The logic board is in excellent condition. Absolutely clean and looks new. 
The problem is that the machine works and runs perfectly normally when the battery is unplugged. When I have the original battery in it boots as it should, but quite quickly the backlight flashes and then goes out. It takes 20 v and charges the battery with 3.9-4.0 amp, but the backlight disappears. Without battery: normal power consumption
I have tried three different batteries and it does the same thing.
I think it might be U5000 (SMC problem) and will look at TCON_BKLT_PWM line tomorrow at the office. If anyone has an obvious solution, I'd like to hear it :-)

Thank you all and especially 2informaticos who allways gives good vibes and advices.

Good night:-)

title: 820-00281 A1707 Battery use -> no backlight...
message:
Same behavior with battery alone (no charger connected)?

If charger and battery both connected, backlight still stays off, if you disconnect J6951?

Check U5255 signals.

message: Hi again. Finally Got the lb out (Damn lot of screws:-). U5255 is well… pp3v3_g3h is Stable and is 3.3 as it should. Had a tiny solderball from pin 6 (3gh). But nothing short… Could it be roastet?

title: 820-00281 A1707 Battery use -> no backlight...
message:
When you have the board placed on the chassis, disconnect the cables, one by on.
Check which connection blocks the backlight.
